explanation: Agent A is correct. In UtTest_Run the local variable UtTestDataBaseEntry is only used to read members (TestName and the function-pointer members Setup/Test/Teardown) and is never used to modify the pointed object. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13, such pointers should be declared to point to const-qualified types when possible (e.g. const UtTestDataBaseEntry_t *). Calling a function via a function-pointer member accessed through a pointer-to-const is a read operation and does not prevent making the pointer-to-const. There is no visible reason in this snippet that requires a non-const pointer (no writes or non-const API usage of the pointed object), so the report of a Rule 8.13 violation is correct.
